DOC.brief_summary: This a randomized controlled study to test the hypothesis that patients who perform in-cast exercises will have superior range of motion immediately post-cast removal, without a concomitant increase in complication rate when compared with a control group who receives standard post cast care which does not include the intervention exercises.
DOC.brief_title: Reducing Range of Motion Deficits Post Radial Fracture
DOC.criteria: patient experienced distal radial fracture patient is over 18 years of age patient can follow instructions and comply with protocol fracture is managed nonoperatively bilateral wrist fractures previous fracture to the affected wrist previous range of motion limitations to the affected wrist involvement of other upper extremity structures (i.e. shoulder)
